Talon:


Talon nodded and Followed Lord Elder.


Kup.

Kup followed salveo =
but he still regrets to leave Roddy, windlord and Nightlight behind 





F=
rom: Kraftlos 
Sent: Monday, April 27, 2009 8:25 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.=
com 
Subject: Re: The Crash Landing and Aftermath





Lord Perseus opened =
the door to the lower level of the base, and water
poured into the room. He=
 motioned for everyone to follow.

"It looks like that ship we saw crash la=
nded in the ocean..." he said
mater of factly. "Look at this place."

What =
had once been their base was now a slab of concrete and metal
with the ocas=
ional structural support poking up from the foundation.
The city, in just a=
s bad of shape, was errily flat with a large number
of buildings simply was=
hed away.

"Looks like we need a new base." said Guardia steping quietly be=
hind
Lord Perseus, sloshing water with each step.

"This base was build fro=
m an old hanger, it wasnt intended to take
that kind of punishment. We coul=
d rebuild here, or we could find a
better location. First we need to make s=
ure the townsfolk are ok;
I'll try to signal Salveo's team, we're going to =
need that shuttle."

Meanwhile...

Celeron lept up from his chair to stair =
at some strange radar
readings. An entire sector on the map had temporarily=
 darkened, then
went clear again. The mass that represnted Atlantis didnt l=
ook right.
He knew it had changed in the last minion attack; but this didnt=
 even
look like the same city anymore.

"Blast... looks like we need to go =
see what's going on." said Celeron
to himself. "Predecons! Report!"

OOC: T=
his would be the Iron Skull predecon base,

Meanwhile...

Salveo walked int=
o the room where Lord Elder was working.

"Atlantis was just devastated by =
a tidal wave. We're going to have to
go back there and assist them.; our ba=
se was destroyed."

On 4/24/09, airly2002@... <airly2002@...=
m> wrote:
> Talon:
>
> "WHAT THE PIT IS GOING HERE????" Cursed Talon, in a =
minion way, while she
> followed guardia and Lord Perseus
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> F=
rom: Kraftlos
> Sent: Tuesday, April 21, 2009 6:08 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogro=
ups.com
> Subject: The Crash Landing and Aftermath
>
>
>
>
>
>
> The engine=
s had been losing power for the last day and a half; but finally
> the giga=
ntic craft could no longer fight the forces that pulled on it and
> its orb=
it began to decay. Knowing that their only hope of survival was to
> safely=
 crash land, the pilot picked an open area of ocean and tried to
> approach=
 at a safe angle to slow itself enough to keep the ship intact.
>
> Lord Pe=
rseus and his crew walked along the bridge that crossed the gap
> between t=
he part of the island where the hangers were located and the
> peninsula ar=
ea where the base sat. Suddenly the sky became dark and a
> rumbling noise =
could be heard, growing louder and louder. He looked up to
> see almost the=
 whole sky occupied by a massive starship seemly heading
> straight for the=
 island. The Atlantis emergency alarm started to sound and
> civilians rush=
ed to their shelters.
>
> "Everyone! To the base! Hurry!" ordered Perseus b=
reaking out into a run.
>
> The rumbling sound continued to get louder. As =
Perseus and his crew reached
> the base door, it was quickly opened for the=
m then shut behind them. He
> ordered everyone to move the lower level of t=
he base. As the ship passed
> over the island, the sound grew so loud that =
the ground shook and weaker
> parts of buildings started to crumble, as in =
an earthquake. The ship
> traveled for another three miles before it touche=
d down in the deep ocean
> waters. The force of the impact sent the ship hu=
ndreds of feet below the
> surface and it continued to sink until coming to=
 rest on the top of an
> underwater mountain. The mass of water displaced b=
y the ship started a
> massive tsunami-like wave, going out in all directio=
ns.
>
> The ground began to shake again and the lights flickered inside the=
 Maximal
> base.
>
> "Sir, what's that noise?" Guardia asked, sealing the l=
ast heavy door to the
> underground section of the base.
>
> The lights con=
tinued to flicker, then went out.
>
> At that moment the ten-story-high wal=
l of water struck Atlantis from the
> east, picking up all the boats in the=
 harbor and tossing them onto the land.
> The parts of the docks that were =
not made of concrete were pushed up and
> destroyed. A moment later the wat=
er hit the buildings in the lower wharf
> area and they immediately collaps=
ed under the intense weight of water.
> Likewise the metal dome that made u=
p the upper story of the Maximal base was
> immediately ripped from its fou=
ndations and carried away, along with
> everything in the command center, t=
he armory, mess hall, and the main bank
> of CR chambers were also picked u=
p and carried away.
>
> The lower floor of the base had a large metal slab =
to protect it from
> bombing, and as the water continued to pour over it, e=
verything on the upper
> floors was ripped away, leaving a clean plate of m=
etal sitting at the bottom
> of the crater that was the base. The buildings=
 along the center of the town
> were a little sturdier and remained standin=
g, though heavily damaged. The
> hanger and all the craft in it were picked=
 up and thrown into the ocean.
>
> As the water came to tower it filled up =
the deep trench around the structure
> then the wall hit it, wrapping it en=
tirely except for the top five stories,
> damaging supports, breaking out a=
ll the windows and destroying the bridges
> that allowed access to the towe=
r. The wave then continued across the rest
> of the island, destroying buil=
dings and carrying away the mass of debris,
> and then all was eerily quiet=
.
>
>
>
